title: Grades 11-12
subject: Extended Content Standards For English Language Arts (2017-)

document.title: North Carolina EXTENDED CONTENT STANDARDS English Language Arts K-12

FFCBD62107544DB7AF7F492918C3229F.description: Use general academic and domain-specific words and phrases across contexts.

B0AEFA11D5F24B33B36FEC5749315767.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.6 – Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for
reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in developing vocabulary
knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

E9CEEBEEE71F4F749B89FB7CD374DB87.description: Demonstrate understanding of simple figures of speech encountered while reading or listening.

8A0BA3DA29CA404A8F185EE53B3204D9.description: CCR Anchor Standard L.5 – Demonstrate understanding of figurative language and nuances in word meanings.

C5117E70724348328A5715169426FA2C.description: Demonstrate knowledge of unknown and multiple-meaning words drawn from grade 11-12 content using context clues.

2AFD8A4C0706498787F9014CA25DD8A1.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.4 – Determine and clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context
clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

2812B1133B5B4DA2870FC7142C082396.description: Use language to achieve desired outcomes when communicating by using a variety of simple and compound sentence structures

B457AD2957344F13AE8664928CD82620.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.3 – Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective
choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully reading or listening.

4022AD2EEF2B460B946C5B0B53DBE221.description: Demonstrate understanding of conventions of standard English within 9-12 conventions continuum when writing.

AA0370D13FA346D296C9856B3EC6D495.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.2 – Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when
writing; demonstrate proficiency within the appropriate grade band conventions continuum.

F4C240A7FACA47F2A6C3EADDBEAEDBB4.description: Demonstrate standard English grammar and usage within the 9-12 grammar continuum when writing or communicating.

7FD7D89E3F6F4C998CEC2A3B0F3B5308.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.1 – Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking;
demonstrate proficiency within the appropriate grade band grammar continuum.

775BEE714CC04F09A99D448C842B4FBB.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.6 – Determine whether information presented in diverse media (book, newspaper, video, television, internet) is
credible and identify discrepancies.

90AC1B6AB7D6405A953DD11C46457EED.description: Use digital media strategically in presentations to support understanding and add interest.

AA1656A2E36B42E7B87375E3951E7E29.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.5 – Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance
understanding of presentations.

2528D4E8E12A4D99BCC173874537FE8F.description:
Communicate findings including relevant descriptions, facts, or details as well as alternative or opposing information, with and
organization that supports purpose, audience and task.

8DE7DF61F0284A50A8CAAD6E79282C6B.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.4 – Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning
and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

289D269109F74D42B97D9806FC96C474.description: Determine whether the claims and reasoning enhance the speaker’s argument on a topic.

AC20AAD2B5F64A60AAC92AA8A57FE049.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.3 – Determine whether information presented in diverse media (book, newspaper, video, television, internet) is
credible and identify discrepancies.

BC5403E623D744998B46EA06E9B32F05.description: Determine the credibility and accuracy of information presented across diverse media or formats.

080ACD36A2A1449DA5FA540FC58D614D.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.2 – Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively,
and orally.

169760BF765948938388EBB4AF72BF01.description: Respond to agreements and disagreements in a discussion.

18C5AD29C82A4473B732B01861BB6D95.description: Ask and answer questions to verify or clarify own ideas and understandings during a discussion.

7E6BC187D30A4A078C0FACE7E2F7A088.description: Work with peers to set rules and goals for discussions.

00ABFC9626534806AD84AB1605827ED7.description: Prepare for discussions by collecting information on the topic.

6F3023FF7C6046F0A3A6B92F832DF6C6.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.1 – Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners,
building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

D3A8FB86F8974A8382B18D1616B117C2.description: Integrated into Standards W.1, W.2, and W.3

D290476C03DD4825A3778FE6D697780B.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.10 (in 2010 Standards) – 2010: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and
revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

50E4A0F93CD04D7A945E30260FF93013.description: Omitted because it is an expectation of RL and RI Standards

8603AEED74CE4D9F8D03EEC2EA7EEC87.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.9 (in 2010 Standards) – 2010: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection,
and research. Proposed: Omitted because it is an expectation of RL and RI Standards

C35EE0AA84004C03BF4AC9608809847A.description: Write answers to research questions by selecting relevant information from multiple resources.

6A4A79B71B2A4D10BE9C74D80EA85672.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.6 (from Proposed Standards – was W.8 in 2010 Standards) – Gather relevant information from multiple print and
digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

C0E0EC58C4294EAA9DF942B2BD27E4E0.description: Conduct research projects to answer questions posed by self and others using multiple sources of information.

9368173C20784209BE19787F7CCBF084.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.5 (from Proposed Standards – was W.7 in 2010 Standards) – Conduct short as well as more sustained research
projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

9C2E3B14429246F6B39D9BBA9F70A505.description: Use digital tools to produce, publish and update an individual or shared writing project.

9176E5A278074DDBB3A23F85A1B3C93C.description: CR Anchor Standard W.4: Use digital tools and resources to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

9311B55B3C4C4F808FB89ACCDC8A7755.description: Use descriptive words and phrases to convey a vivid picture of experiences, events, setting, or characters.

20015E74533C453D9F8EE9A02582BCFC.description: Organize the events in the narrative using temporal words to signal order and add cohesion.

90B3EAD64452414FB60B130BFC6716AD.description: Write a narrative about a problem, situation, or observation including at least one character, details, and clearly sequenced events.

CD9C624BB2EE4879B7F7FD62EAB04F39.description: Write about events or personal experiences.

9216B46912984829BF48CDD4DD82C0B1.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.3 – Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen
details, and well-structured event sequences.

57470D6507534115AECA25FB091EFBDE.description: Provide a closing or concluding statement.

F784AF10F7364F9CA95DB0978F601133.description: Use domain specific vocabulary when writing claims related to a topic of study or text.

FF1D77B0DDA24B30970BDE1E8E933C74.description: Use complete, simple sentences, as well as compound and other complex sentences as appropriate.

D8AFDA6ECB5440A981B7BA68DF18B563.description: Develop the topic with relevant facts, details, or quotes.

2E65438F06DB4258915E5DBA3D008CDC.description:
Introduce a topic clearly and write an informative or explanatory text that conveys ideas, concepts, and information including visual, tactual, or
multimedia information as appropriate.

D60B70F81C534EF8B39B500ED037A2F7.description: Write to share information supported by details.

A6C1BF456751495F8A4FE275A82E2514.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.2 – Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and
accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

B81842ABC65A402492F22792DA8D283D.description: Provide a closing or concluding statement.

621B06BC452C472883FF89B5D70B9150.description: Support claims with reasons and evidence drawn from text.

F335999A354045B7B1EA04C92A248A67.description: Write an argument to support a claim that results from studying a topic or reading a text.

89BF7588585744A68C5045A2E4CCB335.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.1 – Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and
relevant and sufficient evidence.

6B6B18A41B674A5BBA52F2A2A8A0ECA9.description:
Actively engage in reading of information text for sustained periods of time for the purpose of connecting prior knowledge and
experiences to text.

125B0B9390444FBDB66485447FF7B8F8.description:
CR Anchor Standard RI.10: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently, connecting prior
knowledge and experiences to text.

1256859DEEE84E2BAADAAC5641A785AE.description: Compare and contrast the arguments made by authors of two different texts on the same topic

18A8440DD6D64F66A701480CD39221C9.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.9 – Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare
the approaches the authors take.

2178BDE420E142CBBC9B4FC7C49DAE91.description: Demonstrate understandings of claims and arguments in works of public advocacy.

E8D5526230504D8594610BCF500D559E.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.8 – Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as
well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

11C7E81A2CA2452AAC84565AFE01CF8E.description: Analyze information presented in different media on related topics to answer questions or solve problems.

33047153D2C44A798556AD74C52904C1.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.7 – Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively,
as well as in words.

F41D9E56A8404DEAB10DF479A722BEC2.description: Determine author’s point of view and compare and contrast it with own point of view.

09B06EAF4C5F4F45B47C9B9AE91C79FA.description: CCR Anchor Standard RI.6: Assess how point of view, perspective, or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

0438FBC617A24B75A6402934F0856025.description: Determine whether the structure of a text enhances an author’s claim.

D2D66C821C474243B8ECF357629B1044.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.5 – Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text
(e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

E703C2BB7F2D4125BC7EBF6297776323.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text; determine how the author uses a key term over the course of a
text

0093E8FE483D4DB69648BFC21D29B7F4.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.4: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning
or tone.

4D81C22115004FDA84A14C3A9A5E4186.description: Determine how individuals, ideas, or events change over the course of the text.

D97796798FE446F89762C2151D529039.description: CCR Anchor Standard RI.3 – Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

E78FCD4AA95D4CBBB7106C14CE741247.description: Determine the central idea of a text and select details that show how it is conveyed in the text; recount the text.

5AB3E30AE5284A5CBF07A582F5CF555B.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.2 – Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting
details and ideas.

12DFD747CCC64A81BB125C659B03DEE5.description: Analyze a text to determine its meaning and cite textual evidence to support explicit and implicit understanding.

F49C6E2B8CA94F71A9B59073ADDC8E24.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.1 – Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific
textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

0DDC94C7F575493B9AC9DEF191B34A0C.description: Actively engage in reading for the purpose of connecting prior knowledge and experiences to text for sustained periods of time."

A168635E88234132BB4785F96071EB9D.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.10: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently, connecting
prior knowledge and experiences to text.

3E994F05278B49098E36497F0174C90E.description: Compare themes and topics of two or more texts from the same period by different authors.

1221AFDE50594F438C63537A0578D59C.description:
CCRAnchorStandardRL.9 – Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the
approaches the authors take.

3ABE96166CB649A0B5EAC2A5FE1A19CB.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.8 – Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as
well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

D4DD1EF9BD7A41A2B2E37F14C36476AF.description: Compare two or more interpretations of a story, drama, or poem.

84187B0BB9FB4556A90B27546164C963.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.7 – Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively,
as well as in words.

461D7EBEEE9C46CBA99F1575B734DC14.description: Determine the point of view when there is a difference between the author’s actual language and intended meaning.

9400D8C33E014DBF88CFC4993BF84318.description: CCR Anchor Standard RL.6 Assess how point of view, perspective, or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

5EE60B71DB9F4E5CB203A92F897F1D1F.description: Determine how the author’s choice of where to end the story contributes to the meaning.

1A49A8275A3F4A658B5CB80C3609FBB7.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.5 – Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text
(e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

BAAF4ED8C61F4B51B0F77E90643FEF1A.description: Determine the intended meaning of multi-meaning words in a text.

E3C318416CE346C0980D69EA9D402778.description: RL.4: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

1178D6AE4687495B91313E7CF555C108.description: Determine how characters, the setting or events change over the course of the text.

3E01EBE5683D4C0797422EF803868D79.description: CCR Anchor Standard RL.3 –Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

626ABF290F9F45CEA2A5D6249F1F8FFE.description: Recount the main events of the text which are related to the theme or central idea.

B2B99FC0162745C1A4F0362AFB25665B.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.2 –Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting
details and ideas.

72FFA49CC2D143168FC279136C325E67.description: Analyze a text to determine its meaning and cite textual evidence to support explicit and implicit understandings.

91A7F45AF9A041D2862B2AC1BF53FDCA.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.1 – Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific
textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
